Installation of unapproved software or s.Data: Windows Event ID 4688, Windows Event ID 8002, Windows Event ID 8006, Zeek pe.log
Installation of unapproved software or s.Action: Monitor Windows Event ID 4688 for new process creations associated with software installation or updates. Correlate with Code Integrity events (8002/8006) or PE file analysis (Zeek pe.log) to identify executables with missing, expired, or untrusted digital signatures. Flag installations outside of scheduled maintenance windows. Use descriptive statistics to identify rare installation sources or packages.

Execution of newly installed or updated.Data: Windows Event ID 4688, Zeek conn.log, Zeek dns.log
Execution of newly installed or updated.Action: Monitor Windows Event ID 4688 to identify child processes spawned by newly installed or updated executables. Analyze Zeek conn.log and dns.log for network connections made by these processes to unusual or untrusted external destinations. Apply correlation analysis between process execution and network activity to flag suspicious communication patterns. Use frequency analysis on destination IPs/domains to identify rare or malicious connections.
